definition: official seal/imperial or royal seal/papal bull
surname Yin/abbr. for 印度[Yin4 du4]
to print/to mark/to engrave/a seal/a print/a stamp/a mark/a trace/image

sentences.english: The official document issued by the pope was sealed with a bulla.
sentences.chinese: 由教皇颁发的官方文件是用印玺封住的。

sentences.english: A seal of similar design is in the National Palace Museum in Taipei.
sentences.chinese: 台北故宫博物院藏有一件类似印玺。

definition: golden seal/characters tattooed on a convict's face

tiger tally (a two-piece object made in the shape of a tiger, used in ancient China as proof of authority. One half of a tally could be issued to a military officer and this would be matched with the other half when verification was required.)
(archaic) wooden or metal token of authority/(fig.) decree/directive/(computing) token
seal impression/stamp/mark from a seal serving as signature
bamboo writing slips in ancient times (joined together to form whole scrolls)
decorated knob protruding from seal, allowing it to be strung on a cord
